column4: Hello can someone help me figure out why I can't get ssh to work on desktop or Server???
YEah lets do it
Specifically what is the problem?
OK let's do it thanx
what to do first???
What specifically isn't working?  What are you trying to do?
I've really tried very hard to them to work but I'm missing something when it comes to the publickey???
Are you ssh ing over the internet?  Have you ssh'd without a private key (with just a username and password)?
it's intranet and I have tried all the google methods but for sdome reason I can get it to work
Do you have the open-ssh-server package installed on the server?
it keeps saying Permission denied (publickey,password)
so the command you're running is "ssh ironfoot_495@ipofserver" ??
yes
And you installed the openssh-server package on the server?
ed_debian:yes
well actually I use ssh -vv -p 2096 root@ipadd
what does the -vv flag do? Why are you trying to log in as root?  Try to log in as yourself IDK if root is allowed to ssh.  Seems like it would be a security risk.

Also try putting the ip address of your server (the local intranet ip address) instead of it's host name.  Unless you have the name in your host file or you have a DNS server on your intranet host names won't work
are you there???
I think I olost connection
NOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!  we've lost him...
are you still there got disconnected??
